summary: A collection of timesheets and faxes detailing hours worked, tasks performed, and payments owed for house-sitting, maintenance, and coordination at a property associated with Jeffrey Epstein. The documents list various workers, vendors, and interactions with Epstein's staff, including Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as the owner of the house; his friend borrows a Mercedes; he is returning to town.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Met with the timesheet author to discuss house repairs and made a partial payment of $1,000.

persons.context: Asked to call to confirm receipt of a fax regarding hours and payment.

connections.description: Maxwell is managing house repairs and making payments on Epstein's behalf.
Hesse is performing house-sitting and coordination tasks for Epstein's property.
Hesse met with Maxwell to discuss house repairs and received partial payment from her.
Christof is a worker for cars associated with Epstein's house and was driven to unlock a Mercedes for Epstein's friend.

events.title: Airport pick-up of Cook
events.description: Worker picked up an individual named Cook from the airport.

events.title: Meeting with Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Worker met with Ghislaine Maxwell to discuss what needs to be fixed around the house; Maxwell paid $1,000 towards hours owed.

events.title: Mercedes unlocked for Epstein's friend
events.description: Worker picked up Christof, drove to the house to get a Mercedes unlocked, turned off and reset the alarm, and followed Christop back to Jet Aviation, all for Epstein's friend to borrow the car.

events.title: Alarm check and reset
events.description: Worker received a call from security, checked the house and grounds, and tried to reset the alarm. The following day, they spoke to Richard and successfully reset the alarm with help from the alarm company.

locations: Jet Aviation (likely an FBO or airport location)
New York (NY) - where mail was FedExed
keyFacts: Documents show detailed timesheets for house-sitting, maintenance, and coordination at a property owned by Jeffrey Epstein from 2003 to 2005.
Ghislaine Maxwell is directly involved in managing repairs and making payments, evidenced by a meeting and a $1,000 payment she made.

Various workers and vendors are listed, including cleaners (Peaon's), computer workers, painters, electricians, an architect (Douglas), a chef (Brent), and pool and alarm companies, indicating a large household staff and maintenance operation.
Specific tasks include airport pick-ups, unlocking cars for Epstein's friends to borrow, alarm management, and coordinating repairs, highlighting the operational scale of Epstein's properties.
The documents include practical details like alarm passwords ('Paula') and door codes, showing the level of access and responsibility given to the worker(s) compiling these records.
